DOC.brief_summary: African American woman among high rate overweight obesity meet dietary physical activity guideline . The investigator seek develop new intervention strategy help alleviate health disparity , thereby improve quality life , health care cost , disease burden . The African American Collaborative Obesity Research Network ( AACORN ) recommend eco-social , community-engaged approach behavior change line cultural value interconnectedness care others . The purpose study operationalize AACORN paradigm promote improvement weight status health civic engagement approach . To achieve , participant meet church-based Change Clubs lead 6 month curriculum , include lesson cardiovascular risk reduction civic engagement project . Civic engagement may lead change individual health behavior increase self-regulation self-efficacy . The investigator measure club member ' adherence Change Club intervention , define average number session attend , retention club , satisfaction Change Club experience achievement least 50 % self-identified benchmark community change within 6 month . In addition investigator compare anthropometric factor , diet physical activity behavior , blood pressure , cardiorespiratory fitness , psychosocial factor participation Change Club intervention .
DOC.criteria: female ; age 3070 year ; selfidentified African American ; Englishspeaking ; BMI â‰¥25.0 ; currently sedentary ( meet Physical Activity Guidelines Americans ) ; safe initiate moderate physical activity per PARQ . failure provide inform consent ; participation lifestyle modification program ; current use either prescription overthecounter weight loss medication ; inability communicate due severe , uncorrectable hearing loss speech disorder ; severe visual impairment ( precludes completion assessment and/or intervention ) ; plan move outside area within 6 month ; pregnancy ( since weight loss , primary outcome , inadvisable population ) .
